content: I’m a graduate student in language science at the Computational Language and Meaning labs at UC Irvine. My research investigates a pragmatic account of ambiguity resolution, combining behavioral experiments, corpus analysis, and computational cognitive modeling. In particular, I’m interested in how intonation (e.g., emphasis) and context (e.g., the topic of conversation) facilitate everyday language processing.
summary: I’m a graduate student in language science at the Computational Language and Meaning labs at UC Irvine. My research investigates a pragmatic account of ambiguity resolution, combining behavioral experiments, corpus analysis, and computational cognitive modeling.
title: Noa Attali
Acoustic and Speaker Features Underlying Understandability in L2 Speech
Tragicomedy on the Road to Modernity: Interpreting the Genre of The Winter's Tale
